# p0_datadog_audit_logs (Resource)

Allows P0 to send access events and security findings to Datadog Logs

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "p0_datadog_audit_logs" "example" {
  identifier        = "example"
  intake_url        = "https://http-intake.logs.datadoghq.com"
  api_key_cleartext = sensitive("your-datadog-api-key")
  service           = "p0"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `api_key_cleartext` (String, Sensitive) Datadog API key for authentication
- `identifier` (String) A user-specified identifier for this Datadog audit logs configuration
- `intake_url` (String) Datadog logs intake URL (e.g., https://http-intake.logs.datadoghq.com)

### Optional

- `service` (String) Service name for log attribution (optional). Defaults to 'p0'.

### Read-Only

- `api_key_hash` (String) The hash of the API key
- `state` (String) This item's install progress in the P0 application:
	- 'stage': The item has been staged for installation
	- 'configure': The item is available to be added to P0, and may be configured
	- 'installed': The item is fully installed
